#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=CHAPTER II
#Text=His friend the Editor turned to him squarely .
#Text=“ Willie took me into consultation , and since he seems to have let you in I may just as well tell you what is up .
#Text=I shall try to be as short as I can .
#Text=But in confidence — mind ! ”
#Text=He waited .
#Text=Renouard , his uneasiness growing on him unreasonably , assented by a nod , and the other lost no time in beginning .

#Text=Professor Moorsom — physicist and philosopher — fine head of white hair , to judge from the photographs — plenty of brains in the head too — all these famous books — surely even Renouard would know . . . .

#Text=Renouard muttered moodily that it was n’t his sort of reading , and his friend hastened to assure him earnestly that neither was it his sort — except as a matter of business and duty , for the literary page of that newspaper which was his property ( and the pride of his life ) .
#Text=The only literary newspaper in the Antipodes could not ignore the fashionable philosopher of the age .
#Text=Not that anybody read Moorsom at the Antipodes , but everybody had heard of him — women , children , dock labourers , cabmen .

#Text=The only person ( besides himself ) who had read Moorsom , as far as he knew , was old Dunster , who used to call himself a Moorsomian ( or was it Moorsomite ) years and years ago , long before Moorsom had worked himself up into the great swell he was now , in every way . . .
#Text=Socially too .
#Text=Quite the fashion in the highest world .
#Text=Renouard listened with profoundly concealed attention .
#Text=“ A charlatan , ” he muttered languidly .
#Text=“ Well — no .
#Text=I should say not .
#Text=I should n’t wonder though if most of his writing had been done with his tongue in his cheek .
#Text=Of course .
#Text=That ’s to be expected .
#Text=I tell you what : the only really honest writing is to be found in newspapers and nowhere else — and do n’t you forget it . ”
#Text=The Editor paused with a basilisk stare till Renouard had conceded a casual :

#Text=“ I dare say , ” and only then went on to explain that old Dunster , during his European tour , had been made rather a lion of in London , where he stayed with the Moorsoms — he meant the father and the girl .
#Text=The professor had been a widower for a long time .
#Text=“ She does n’t look just a girl , ” muttered Renouard .
#Text=The other agreed .
#Text=Very likely not .
#Text=Had been playing the London hostess to tip-top people ever since she put her hair up , probably .
#Text=“ I do n’t expect to see any girlish bloom on her when I do have the privilege , ” he continued .
#Text=“ Those people are staying with the Dunster ’s incog . , in a manner , you understand — something like royalties .
#Text=They do n’t deceive anybody , but they want to be left to themselves .
#Text=We have even kept them out of the paper — to oblige old Dunster .
#Text=But we shall put your arrival in — our local celebrity . ”
#Text=“ Heavens ! ”
#Text=“ Yes .
#Text=Mr. G. Renouard , the explorer , whose indomitable energy , etc. , and who is now working for the prosperity of our country in another way on his Malata plantation . . .
#Text=And , by the by , how ’s the silk plant — flourishing ? ”
#Text=“ Yes . ”
#Text=“ Did you bring any fibre ? ”
#Text=“ Schooner-full . ”
#Text=“ I see .
#Text=To be transhipped to Liverpool for experimental manufacture , eh ?
#Text=Eminent capitalists at home very much interested , are n’t they ? ”
#Text=“ They are . ”
#Text=A silence fell .
#Text=Then the Editor uttered slowly — “ You will be a rich man some day . ”
#Text=Renouard ’s face did not betray his opinion of that confident prophecy .
#Text=He did n’t say anything till his friend suggested in the same meditative voice —
#Text=“ You ought to interest Moorsom in the affair too — since Willie has let you in . ”
#Text=“ A philosopher ! ”
#Text=“ I suppose he is n’t above making a bit of money .
#Text=And he may be clever at it for all you know .
#Text=I have a notion that he ’s a fairly practical old cove . . . .
#Text=Anyhow , ” and here the tone of the speaker took on a tinge of respect , “ he has made philosophy pay . ”
#Text=Renouard raised his eyes , repressed an impulse to jump up , and got out of the arm-chair slowly .
#Text=“ It is n’t perhaps a bad idea , ” he said .
#Text=“ I ’ll have to call there in any case . ”
#Text=He wondered whether he had managed to keep his voice steady , its tone unconcerned enough ; for his emotion was strong though it had nothing to do with the business aspect of this suggestion .
#Text=He moved in the room in vague preparation for departure , when he heard a soft laugh .
#Text=He spun about quickly with a frown , but the Editor was not laughing at him .
#Text=He was chuckling across the big desk at the wall : a preliminary of some speech for which Renouard , recalled to himself , waited silent and mistrustful .
#Text=“ No ! You would never guess ! No one would ever guess what these people are after .
#Text=Willie ’s eyes bulged out when he came to me with the tale . ”
#Text=“ They always do , ” remarked Renouard with disgust .
#Text=“ He ’s stupid . ”
#Text=“ He was startled .
#Text=And so was I after he told me .
#Text=It ’s a search party .
#Text=They are out looking for a man .
#Text=Willie ’s soft heart ’s enlisted in the cause . ”
#Text=Renouard repeated :
#Text=“ Looking for a man . ”
#Text=He sat down suddenly as if on purpose to stare . “ Did Willie come to you to borrow the lantern , ” he asked sarcastically , and got up again for no apparent reason .
#Text=“ What lantern ? ” snapped the puzzled Editor , and his face darkened with suspicion .
#Text=“ You , Renouard , are always alluding to things that are n’t clear to me .
#Text=If you were in politics , I , as a party journalist , would n’t trust you further than I could see you .
#Text=Not an inch further .
#Text=You are such a sophisticated beggar .
#Text=Listen : the man is the man Miss Moorsom was engaged to for a year .
#Text=He could n’t have been a nobody , anyhow .
#Text=But he does n’t seem to have been very wise .
#Text=Hard luck for the young lady . ”
